page.title: 01CURDWORTH & WATER ORTON AREA
page.content: THIS BLOCK HAS BEEN SURVEYED BY CURDWORTH W.I. AND FRIENDS THEREFORE IT IS CENTRED AROUND CURDWORTH - THE VILLAGE OF CURDWORTH IS A SMALL FRIENDLY, QUIET, PLEASANT PLACE TO LIVE WITH FARMS IN THE SURROUNDING AREA IT STILL HAS A FEEL OF BEING IN THE COUNTRYSIDE. THERE IS, HOWEVER THE SEWAGE WORKS TO ONE SIDE AND NOW THE MOTORWAY TO THE OTHER. WATER ORTON IS LARGER WITH A BUSY PARADE OF SHOPS AND A RAILWAY STATION BUT STILL KEEPS ITS FRIENDLY VILLAGE ATMOSPHERE. WATER ORTON IS ONLY PARTLY IN THIS BLOCK. THE SURROUNDING AREA HAS TRUNK ROADS, CANAL, SEWAGE WORKS, POWER STATION, FARMS AND MOTORWAYS. THE CURDWORTH WATER ORTON SECTION OF THE M42 BEING BUILT IN 1985 HAS CAUSED MUCH DIFFICULTY WITH THE LAND COVER. BOTH VILLAGES HAVE A PARISH CHURCH, SCHOOLS PLAYING FIELDS, BUS SERVICES & CLUBS.
